title: A champ that borrows other champs abilities concept?
body:
So i was thinking of some new champ ideas and concepts and i thought about this.
What if their was a champ that sort of borrowed or copied abilities from other champs?

Maybe they could borrow the ability for a short time or have a limited use of said copied ability but it would be weaker than the original ability.  
I was also thinking maybe this new champ could be like a shapeshifter or a ditto or something.

Its all just an idea i spontaneously had but what do you guys think of it?
in terms of copying ults, im not really sure if that would be balanced unless perhaps using a copied ult used up a bunch of mana or something.

This has been attempted a few times in a few champion concepts I've seen. Personally I really don't see it working without some really clever mechanics on top of that 'core' mechanic. There are a lot of problems involved.....

* Uncopyable abilities (as Skelenth said) like Azir W
* Combo Abilities like Zilean Q would be awful to copy
* Having a single ability that can be *any* ability means that it, by it's very nature, cannot synergize with the rest of this hypothetical champion's normal kit

Now this does not at all mean it's impossible for this kind of champion to exist.

For example, a whiiiiiiile back I saw a ditto/copy champion kit that, as an ultimate, copied an ally. While copied, this champion would look exactly like the target (think the mirror in brawlers) and have access to all abilities with a cooldown less than 20 seconds (so no actual ultimates, but still including things like Akali R). When this champion used an ability the illusion is broken, but at the end of the day you could copy a Thresh and send another Q out, or copy a Fizz and troll-pole your way out of something.

Honestly it was so far back I don't remember the concept and I can't remember the rest of the kit but it stuck with me because it was a way to make this kind of mechanic work.

They key is to allow this 'copy' mechanic to be more than just 'get another ability'. Because that *by itself* is simply not a viable mechanic, but adding in stuff like visual cloning and illusions let's this mechanic pair with some fun playstyle changes and make it more favorable.
To be fair, there is evidence of it working even by itself. Just look at DoTA's Rubick.

True true, I will admit dota is much more willing to cross lines in terms of balance. It's a more 'throw it in and see what happens' kinda game when it comes to champs. Imho that just means that they have more confidence in their playerbase to adapt than Riot does for League.

Welp, the main problem is that, at 126 possible copyable champions and four abilities per champion, we're looking at a guy who'd have to have 504 animations on him.

DOTA2 uses the archaic WC3 mod system, which is why abilities can be disjointed from animations, and they just have a set of generic melee animations or ranged animations for their abilities, this is why ability draft is possible in DOTA2.

LoL however does not.

That does sound pretty challenging to code tbh...
i mean im no coder obvis but one can dream right c:

Do you think there would be anyway to still implement something similar though?

There's an easy out, have the character have an animation where he throws something, make it look generic like a ballista shot or something.

Now, allow this character to catch projectiles like Yasuo or Braum, but as a one-time only thing, he then holds the projectile for a while and has a chance to throw it back, using the generic animation.

This would STILL be a bitch to code for abilities which have several independent projectiles (Ashe, MF, Diana), but would lead to VERY interesting gameplay where you want to catch a GOOD one, like a Veigars ult, but have to time it right not to catch a BAD one, like a Soraka AA.

Melee abilities and attacks however, are basically impossible to catch/copy and then reproduce, because of their nature, It'd be hard to have a guy copy CHOs R, and make it work with the same animations he makes work a Darius Q.

I always wanted an ult that let gave you a buff, allowing you to use the target's ultimate within a certain amount of time, with a few exceptions for ultimate differences. You don't need the whole kit to copy your opponent, just an ult will do. 

For champions like Karma or Heimerdinger, he gets one of his own abilities buffed. 

Against Jayce, Elise, or Nidalee, he could gain an alternate form that grants him more power for a short time. 

Against toggles, like Anivia or Swain, he could activate it for a set period of time to turn it on and off for free, then it goes on a shortened cooldown. 

Against multi cast ultimates, like Ahri or Kog'Maw, he could have a set time to cast lots of times. 

Finally, against {{champion:157}} specifically, he gets a chance to knock up, then reactivate to cast the ultimate.

I was trying to think of a way to incorporate a "ricochet" mechanic in a champion. Instead of blocking it like a Braum shield or Yasuo windwall the ability would bounce the projectile away and damage whomever it hits (allies or enemies). It would require precise positioning to maximize the damage to enemies and minimize damage to allies. 

There could also be an absorbing mechanic that allows the champion to copy an ability of another champion. Kind of like Rogue from X-men or Buu from Dragonball Z. I imagine it to be similar to Fiora riposte, where it negates the damage and allows you to then cast the absorbed ability. It might be difficult for a player to understand all of the projectile skillshots in the game enough to logistically pull off, but a cool concept, nonetheless.
